intro: Draco camerooniana, commonly known as the Cameroon draco, is a rare and unique plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Dracunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and often brightly colored stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow, followed by fruit that splits open to release seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
